title: Pistons maintain 'poise,' snap record playoffs skid
content: The Detroit Pistons snapped their NBA-record 15-game postseason losing streak by beating the New York Knicks 100-94.

title: Finally healthy, Kawhi's throwback effort ties series
content: Kawhi Leonard, who scored 39 points Monday night to help the Clippers even their series with the Nuggets, said afterward, "I'm just happy that I'm able to move" after watching the past two playoffs from the sidelines.

title: Thibs: Brunson not getting calls like Cunningham
content: The Knicks-Pistons first-round playoff series is even -- and Knicks coach Tom Thibodeau said afterward the free throws need to be as well.

title: Ovechkin nets 1st playoff OT goal, Caps top Habs
content: Washington star forward Alex Ovechkin made some personal history in the Capitals' Game 1 win over the Montreal Canadiens on Monday night, scoring the first playoff overtime goal of his storied career en route to a 3-2 win for the No. 1 seed in the East.

title: Source: Younger Iamaleava to join Nico at UCLA
content: Madden Iamaleava, the younger brother of Nico Iamaleava, is expected to join the former Tennessee quarterback at UCLA, a source said Monday.

title: Sources: UCLA's Aguilar to transfer to Tennessee
content: Quarterback Joey Aguilar, who threw for 6,760 yards and 56 touchdowns the past two years with Appalachian State, plans to transfer to Tennessee after transferring to UCLA in the winter portion of the transfer portal, sources told ESPN's Chris Low Monday.

title: Harrison: Didn't know fans' level of love for Luka
content: Nico Harrison said he underestimated the level to which Mavericks fans cared for Luka Doncic and reiterated the blowback to the trade would've eased if the team had been healthy.

title: NCAA floats rules for direct payments to players
content: The NCAA proposed deleting 153 rules from its handbook, a move that will allow schools to share financial benefits directly with players.

title: 'Completely separate and at odds': The divisions and chaos that led to the end of the Luka Doncic era in Dallas
content: Doncic's time in Dallas ended with a shocking trade on Feb. 2, but the beginning of the end dates to the summer of 2023.

title: 'Football is a chess game': How Abdul Carter rose to the top of NFL draft boards amid position change
content: After earning Penn State's famed No. 11 jersey, how has Abdul Carter positioned himself to be a top-5 pick?

title: Marcus Rashford at a crossroads: Can he star at Man United again, or must he leave?
content: Marcus Rashford's options are clear this summer -- fight his way back at Man United, try to join Aston Villa permanently or start somewhere new -- but how he got here depends on whom you ask.

title: Leeds, Burnley win, clinch Premier League return
content: Leeds United and Burnley have been promoted to the Premier League after Scott Parker's side beat third-placed Sheffield United on Monday.

title: Alonso has 'gentleman's agreement' to exit Bayer
content: Bayer Leverkusen's CEO has said the club has a "gentleman's agreement" with Xabi Alonso that means he could take over at Real Madrid or Liverpool.

title: Wrexham edge closer to promotion with key win
content: Wrexham climbed back into the automatic promotion spots in League 1 with a crucial 2-1 win over Blackpool on Monday.

title: In Vice-President Dhankhar's Fresh Strike, Mention Of Chief Justice's Uncle
content: In his fresh attack targeting the judiciary and stressing that Parliament is "supreme", Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar mentioned Justice Hans Raj Khanna, a former top court judge who stood up to the Indira Gandhi government during the Emergency

title: "Respect For Judiciary Is Paramount'': Top Government Sources Amid Row
content: Respect for the judiciary is paramount and all pillars of democracy are working in tandem for a Viksit Bharat, top sources in the government have said amid the massive row over the remarks of Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar and BJP MPs

title: Exclusive - 6 Airbases, 1 Big Move: China's Play Against India
content: China is actively enhancing six new air bases, strengthening its air power and presenting a significant challenge to India's defences along the Himalayan frontier.

title: Pilot Killed After Trainer Aircraft Crashes In Gujarat's Amreli District
content: A trainee pilot was killed when a trainer aircraft belonging to a private aviation academy crashed in a residential area in Gujarat's Amreli district on Tuesday afternoon and caught fire, a police official said.

title: Pope Francis Funeral To Be Held On April 26 At Vatican, Huge Crowd Expected
content: Pope Francis, 88, died on Monday from a stroke, less than a month after returning home from five weeks in hospital battling double pneumonia.

title: UP Government Transfers 33 IAS Officers, Including 11 District Magistrates
content: In a major administrative reshuffle, the Uttar Pradesh government transferred 33 IAS officers, including district magistrates of 11 districts and three IPS officers, officials said here on Tuesday.

title: Delhi Police Asked To Downgrade Atishi's Security Cover To 'Y' Category
content: The Ministry of Home Affairs has directed Delhi Police to downgrade the security cover provided to former Delhi chief minister and Aam Aadmi Party leader Atishi from 'Z' to 'Y' category, police sources said on Tuesday.

title: "Mumbai's Bullet Train Station Taking Shape 100 Feet Ground": Minister
content: The Minister of Railways Ashwini Vaishnaw through social media post showed the progress of the Mumbai Bullet Train Station.

title: Pope, Exhausted And Weak, Pulled Off A Surprise On His Last Outing
content: Pope Francis looked visibly drained when he drove around St Peter's Square in his popemobile on Easter Sunday, cheered by a rapt crowd in what became his final public appearance.

title: 'Money Used To Build Mosques': Ramdev In Court Trouble, Courtesy Rooh Afza
content: Yoga guru Ramdev has run into fresh trouble with the courts. The Delhi High Court has observed that the Patanjali Ayurved founder's 'sharbat jihad' remark on popular squash drink Rooh Afza was "indefensible" and shook the "conscience" of the court.

title: Gold Prices Soar Amid Market Turbulence, Cross Rs 1 Lakh Per 10 Grams
content: Gold prices have crossed Rs 1 lakh for 10 grams in India as the yellow metal witnesses a record rally driven by uncertainties in global markets.

title: Air Force Officer Charged With 'Attempt To Murder' In Bengaluru Assault Case
content: Indian Air Force officer, Wing Commander Shiladitya Bose, who was allegedly assaulted by a biker in Bengaluru during a "road rage", is now facing a case of 'Attempt to Murder' after the biker, Vikas Kumar, filed a counter-case against the officer.

title: Trump, Zelensky: World Leaders Who Will Attend Pope Francis' Funeral
content: Tributes have poured in from around the globe for Pope Francis, a liberal reformer who took over following the resignation of German theologian Benedict XVI in 2013.

title: India Halts Rail Projects In Bangladesh Amid Political Turmoil: Report
content: India has reportedly paused railway projects in Bangladesh, which were intended to provide connectivity to northeast states through Bangladesh and is planning alternative routes to ensure stability and strategic security in the region.

title: US Slaps Tariffs Up To 3,521% On Solar Imports From These Asian Nations
content: In its latest tariff salvo, the Trump administration in the United States has imposed new duties-- as high as 3,521%-- on solar imports from Southeast Asian countries.

title: The Pope Who Wasn't There: Benedict's Triple Papacy
content: Benedict IX, a pope in the 11th century, holds the rare distinction of becoming a pope three times, selling the papacy, being deposed, reinstated, and eventually excommunicated.

title: "In Anger, I Forgot My Limits": Anurag Kashyap's Apology Over 'Brahmin' Remark
content: Acclaimed filmmaker Anurag Kashyap has apologised for his allegedly casteist remark against the Brahmin community.

title: Andhra Pradesh IPS Officer Arrested In Mumbai Actor Harassment Case
content: An Indian Police Service (IPS) officer has been arrested by Andhra Pradesh police for the alleged harassment and wrongful arrest of a Mumbai-based actor.

title: Antony goal helps keep Betis' UCL 'dreams' alive
content: Real Betis scored three goals in a first-half blitz to beat Girona 3-1 in La Liga on Monday and keep alive its hopes of European football next season.

title: Postecoglou rues 'unacceptable' loss to Forest
content: The rare smile Tottenham Hotspur manager Ange Postecoglou wore four days ago in Frankfurt was replaced by the more familiar frown as a 2-1 home defeat to Nottingham Forest made it 18 Premier League losses for the London club this season.

title: Italian soccer pauses as Pope Francis dies at 88
content: Monday's Serie A fixtures have been postponed following the death of Pope Francis, the Italian league has announced.

title: Vardy on relegation: Miserable and embarrassing
content: Jamie Vardy criticised himself and his fellow Leicester City players following their relegation from the Premier League, saying his own performance in the campaign had been an "embarrassment".

title: Chivas fires Espinoza after missing postseason
content: Chivas has sacked head coach Gerardo Espinoza after the Liga MX giants recently closed out the 2025 Clausura regular season without making the playoffs.

title: The Champions League race so intense it's sure to last to the Premier League's final day
content: Five Premier League teams are fighting for three undecided Champions League spots, and it promises fireworks the rest of the way from here.

title: Should Trent Alexander-Arnold think twice about leaving Liverpool for Real Madrid?
content: Trent Alexander-Arnold has a big decision to make: sign a new deal at Liverpool this summer or leave for (we think) Real Madrid. Considering recent trends at both teams, he should reconsider joining Los Blancos.

title: A win away from the title, Liverpool coronation begins at Leicester
content: Liverpool's fans were already celebrating the title in the win at Leicester. The team itself will soon join in.

title: Drivers, teams who need a reset after F1's first five races
content: It's been a whirlwind to start the F1 season, five races in six weekends, and these names could use a breather.

title: 'Hello, old friend': Randy Orton delivers surprise RKO on John Cena at Raw
content: A day after winning his record 17th WWE title, John Cena ran into a familiar foe on Monday Night Raw.

title: WrestleMania 41 results: Cena makes history, beats Rhodes for WWE Undisputed title
content: The next chapter of John Cena's farewell tour kicks off with the WWE Universal championship around his waist.

title: Stanley Cup Playoffs Central: Bracket, schedule, scores, news
content: From the first round all the way through the Stanley Cup Final, ESPN has you covered this NHL postseason.

title: MLS Power Rankings: Is Charlotte a threat to league's best?
content: After beating impressive San Diego, Charlotte is approaching the summit of ESPN's latest MLS Power Rankings.

title: NWSL Power Rankings: KC, Spirit leapfrog Orlando at the top
content: Orlando's first defeat of 2025 cost the Pride, who fell behind KC and Washington in our latest rankings.

title: OU conquers '24 demons, reclaims gymnastics title
content: Fueled by last season's stunning early exit, Oklahoma reclaimed its place atop the college gymnastics world.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United eye River Plate star Mastantuono
content: Manchester United are considering a move for emerging River Plate star Franco Mastantuono. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Vatican Releases Photo Of Pope Francis In Coffin Ahead Of His Funeral
content: The images were taken in the chapel of the Casa Santa Marta, Pope Francis's residence at the Vatican where he died.

title: Trump's Approval Rating Dips To Lowest Since His Return To White House: Poll
content: The start of Trump's term has left his political opponents stunned as he has signed dozens of executive orders expanding his influence over both government departments and over private institutions such as universities and law firms.

title: 'Parliament is supreme': VP Dhankhar renews attack on judiciary over powers
content: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar emphasized the supremacy of Parliament and the ultimate authority of elected legislators at a Constitutional lecture series at Delhi University. He highlighted that public representatives are accountable to the people, who hold the supreme power.

title: Indian cricketer breaks silence on domestic violence and dowry charges
content: Amit Mishra, the former Indian spinner, has refuted media reports alleging his involvement in a domestic violence and dowry harassment case filed by his wife. He dismissed the accusations, including demands for compensation and dowry, as incorrect and warned of legal action against using his image in unrelated stories.

title: UPSC 2025 results declared: Shakti Dubey secures Rank 1
content: The Union Public Service Commission (UPSC) has declared the final results of the Civil Services Examination, 2024. Shakti Dubey has topped the list of 1009 recommended candidates. The result includes appointments to the IAS, IFS, IPS, and Central Services (Group A and B). A reserve list of 230 candidates has also been maintained. The result, released in April 2025, includes category-wise and disability-wise details, with full marks expected to be available on the UPSC website soon.

title: Intel's fired CEO reveals 2 things Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang got right
content: Former Intel CEO Pat Gelsinger admitted Nvidia's AI chip dominance stemmed from superior execution by CEO Jensen Huang and strategic advantages like NVLink and CUDA. Intel's missteps, including manufacturing delays and failure to adapt to AI demand, led to financial losses and Gelsinger's departure.

title: Royal escort: Saudi fighter jets escort PM Modi’s plane - Watch
content: In a rare display of camaraderie, Saudi fighter jets escorted Prime Minister Narendra Modi's aircraft as it entered Saudi airspace en route to Jeddah, underscoring the robust ties between India and Saudi Arabia.

title: IIT-Kharagpur student found hanging in hostel room
content: Aniket Walkar, a 22-year-old IIT-Kharagpur student, was tragically found dead in his hostel room on Sunday evening, prompting a police investigation. This marks the third student death at the institute in less than a year. Despite being a high-achieving student with a job offer, Aniket's death has left friends and faculty shocked.

title: Tesla CEO Elon Musk shares 'Hot Girl' scam warning
content: Elon Musk shared a meme on X, cautioning against cryptocurrency scams that often use fake female profiles to lure victims, highlighting the significant financial losses reported in 2023 due to such fraudulent schemes. Separately, Musk expressed concerns about the 'woke mind virus,' referencing a post about the increasing percentage of US adults identifying as transgender, advocating for its decline.

title: Air tag, passport copy expose wife's affair, crack Dubai-returnee's murder
content: A suitcase found in a UP field led to the shocking murder of Naushad Ahmad, who had returned from Dubai days earlier. Police traced clues like a passport copy and airport tag to uncover that his wife and nephew—also her lover—allegedly killed and dismembered him. The duo feared exposure of their affair. Both accused have been arrested.

title: Goodbye China, Namaste India! Laptop brands shift production
content: India's IT hardware PLI scheme is boosting domestic laptop production as global brands partner with Indian manufacturers amid China-US trade tensions. Companies like Asus, MSI and HP are establishing or expanding local manufacturing, attracted by incentives.

title: Trump Tariffs: Amazon CEO makes a 'promise', says that I understand why, I mean ...
content: Amidst escalating tariffs imposed by the Trump administration, Amazon is navigating challenges to shield consumers from rising costs. CEO Andy Jassy acknowledges the strain on businesses, anticipating price increases from third-party sellers. Amazon is strategically mitigating impact through bulk purchases and renegotiated contracts, while observing early signs of consumer stockpiling in response to expected price hikes.

title: Trainer aircraft crashes in Gujarat's Amreli, pilot killed
content: A trainer aircraft belonging to a private aviation academy crashed in Gujarat's Amreli on Tuesday, resulting in the death of the pilot. The accident occurred around 12:30 pm near Giriya Road, shortly after the pilot took off from Amreli airport. The aircraft struck a tree before crash-landing in an open plot near Shastri Nagar, preventing further casualties.

title: 'Will visit troubled areas of Murshidabad in May': Mamata
content: West Bengal's Chief Minister plans to visit Murshidabad in early May following violence during anti-Waqf Act protests that resulted in fatalities and displacement. The unrest has sparked political clashes, with the opposition criticizing the ruling party and demanding investigations.

title: 'Shocks conscience': HC pulls up Ramdev for 'sherbat jihad' remarks
content: The Delhi High Court criticized Ramdev for comments against Hamdard's Rooh Afza. He accused them of “Sharbat Jihad”. The court found his remarks indefensible. Hamdard's lawyer called it hate speech and communal division. Ramdev's counsel assured the court that related videos would be removed. This followed Ramdev's claim that Rooh Afza's profits fund madrasas and mosques.

title: Chilli powder blinded him, 12 stab wounds killed ex-Karnataka DGP
content: Former Karnataka DGP Om Prakash was murdered by his wife Pallavi during lunch at their Bengaluru home. She stabbed him multiple times after an alleged history of domestic violence. Pallavi later confessed via WhatsApp. A property dispute and claims of abuse, drugging, and digital surveillance are being probed. Their daughter Kriti's role remains unclear. Investigation continues.

title: Gauhati high court receives bomb threat from 'Madras Tigers', search ops on
content: Gauhati High Court received a bomb threat via email from an unknown organization named 'Madras Tigers,' prompting Assam Police to launch a search operation. Experts are thoroughly checking the premises, though officials suspect it may be a hoax. Despite the threat, the court's functioning has not been disrupted, and judges are proceeding with scheduled cases.

title: Former Australia cricketer sentence to 4 years in jail for domestic violence
content: Former Australian Test cricketer Michael Slater received a four-year jail sentence for domestic violence and other charges, but will be released immediately due to time already served. Judge Glen Cash attributed Slater's issues to alcoholism, which ended his career.

title: IPL 2025 playoffs qualification scenarios explained
content: The IPL 2025 playoff race intensifies as Gujarat Titans lead with 12 points and a strong NRR. Delhi Capitals, Royal Challengers Bangalore, and Punjab Kings closely follow, all vying for a top-four spot. Kolkata Knight Riders, Rajasthan Royals, SunRisers Hyderabad and Chennai Super Kings are in the bottom four.

title: Suspended Congress leader explains 'empty seats' at Kharge's rally
content: Manoj Kumar Pandey, Congress Buxar district chief, is suspended. The suspension follows Mallikarjun Kharge's rally in Buxar. Pandey blames the heat for low turnout. He claims attendees sought shade due to high temperatures. Party sources cite poor coordination as the reason. Eyewitnesses report many empty chairs during Kharge's address. The Congress prepares for crucial Bihar elections later this year.

title: Vatican releases first images of Pope Francis in open coffin
content: The Vatican released the first photo and video of Pope Francis in repose, dressed in red liturgical vestments. He died at 88 from a cerebral stroke, as confirmed by Dr. Andrea Arcangeli. Pope Francis requested a modest burial at the Papal Basilica of St Mary Major, departing from the tradition of entombing popes at St Peter’s Basilica.

title: Watch: Residents block Omar Abdullah's convoy to protest handling of Ramban flood
content: Ramban residents confronted Chief Minister Omar Abdullah about flood and landslide hardships after heavy rains claimed three lives and devastated the region. Political leaders are urging the Centre to declare it a national disaster and provide financial aid. Essential services restoration is underway, with NDRF, SDRF, army, and police on the ground.

title: Why Shubhman Gill and Abhishek Sharma are ‘scared’ of Yuvraj Singh
content: Shubman Gill and Abhishek Sharma, mentored by Yuvraj Singh, apparently are intimidated by his strict guidance, revealed Yuvraj's mother. Yuvraj actively reviews their performances. Meanwhile, B Sai Sudharsan, after his impressive innings alongside Shubman Gill in IPL 2025, praised Gill's experience and their effective partnership. Sudharsan's stellar form and Gill's continued success helped Gujarat Titans post a competitive total.

title: 'Injury was serious... people I knew stopped picking my calls'
content: Krishan Kumar, an Indian athlete, faced a setback after a ligament tear during training in Switzerland before the World Championships. Despite the injury, he competed but fell short of his best. Further injury threatened his Olympic dream, leading to isolation. Supported by his family and army background, Krishan persevered through rehab, avoiding surgery.

title: ‘Indian housewife smartest fund manager’: Uday Kotak as gold prices cross Rs 1 lakh
content: As gold prices in India surpassed Rs 1 lakh per 10 grams, Uday Kotak praised Indian housewives for their investment acumen in gold. Kotak highlighted their long-term investment strategy as a smart way to store value amidst global economic uncertainty and rising geopolitical tensions, which have driven gold prices to record highs both domestically and internationally.

title: IPL 2025: Harsha Bhogle clears air on his absence from KKR vs GT match
content: Harsha Bhogle refuted claims that the Cricket Association of Bengal (CAB) influenced his absence from the Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) versus Gujarat Titans IPL match. Bhogle clarified he was only scheduled for two Kolkata games, his appearances predetermined before the tournament.

title: Bansuri Swaraj pulls a Priyanka, flaunts 'National Herald ki loot' bag
content: BJP MP Bansuri Swaraj countered Congress's political messaging in Parliament by carrying a tote bag criticizing the Gandhis over the National Herald case. This action follows Priyanka Gandhi's previous use of bags to express solidarity with various causes. The ED's chargesheet against Sonia and Rahul Gandhi alleges money laundering of ₹5,000 crore, while Congress dismisses the case as politically motivated.

title: B'luru biker, IAF officer clash snowballs into language row; new video adds twist
content: A road-rage incident in East Bengaluru involving IAF officers Wing Commander Shiladitya Bose and Squadron Leader Madhumita Dutta turned into a language controversy after Bose alleged abuse in Kannada. His viral video sparked outrage, but CCTV footage revealed he assaulted the biker. Police clarified it as a routine road rage case, unrelated to language or regional bias.

title: What is Ashwin doing?
content: K Srikkanth has criticized R Ashwin's bowling approach during a recent match. He feels Ashwin was too defensive and not focused on taking wickets. Srikkanth also questioned Chennai Super Kings' team selection. He believes the team's performance this season has been disappointing. Srikkanth suggests CSK should start preparing for the next season.

title: KKR playoffs scenario explained
content: Kolkata Knight Riders face a tough road to the IPL playoffs after a recent loss, sitting at 7th with only 3 wins. They need at least 5 wins in their remaining 6 games to reach the safe 16-point mark. Their strong Net Run Rate offers hope.

title: Wife's schizophrenia, her SOS before murdering ex-K'taka DGP- What we know so far
content: The shocking murder of former Karnataka Police chief Om Prakash, allegedly by his wife Pallavi, has triggered widespread outrage. Pallavi was arrested following a complaint by their son, Kartikesh, suspecting her involvement. Police reports indicate Pallavi attacked Prakash with chilli powder and a kitchen knife during lunch, citing domestic violence as the motive.

title: Who was this Nevada vet found dead after video of him kicking horse went viral?
content: Dr. Shawn Frehner, a Nevada veterinarian, was found dead in Lake Mead after disappearing amid outrage over a video showing him kicking a horse. Facing felony animal abuse charges for the incident involving the horse named Big Red, Frehner's truck and belongings were discovered near the reservoir.

title: Is Trump administration planning to replace Pete Hegseth as Pentagon chief?
content: Pete Hegseth, the Pentagon chief, is under scrutiny for allegedly sharing classified military operational information via Signal, potentially compromising US pilot safety. The White House is reportedly considering replacements, though these claims are refuted by the press secretary. Hegseth dismisses misconduct allegations, attributing them to disgruntled former staff, while facing criticism over his experience and Pentagon operations.

title: From funeral to ‘Habemus Papam’: What follows the death of a Pope
content: Following Pope Francis's death on April 21, 2025, the Vatican initiates a meticulously planned process steeped in Catholic tradition. The rituals include confirmation of death in the chapel, preparation of the body for viewing, and placement in a wooden coffin with symbolic items.

title: How AAP lost hold over MCD in less than 3 years of win
content: Aam Aadmi Party withdrew from Delhi mayoral elections, alleging BJP's use of unethical tactics like horse-trading and intimidation to sway AAP councillors. AAP leaders claimed the BJP's non-cooperation hindered their work in the MCD. BJP countered that AAP knew it would lose and had neglected MCD duties, hinting at a possible AAP-Congress alliance, while Congress decided to contest.

title: Gold prices cross Rs 1 lakh in physical market; hits Rs 99,178/10gms on MCX
content: Gold rate today: Gold futures soared to a record high of Rs 1,00,000 per 10 grams, driven by investors seeking safe-haven assets amid US Federal Reserve reforms and global trade tensions. International markets also saw gold prices surge, crossing USD 3,500 per ounce, fueled by uncertainty in global financial markets and escalating US-China trade war.

title: Couple caught having sex inside bus in bus; conductor faces action
content: Navi Mumbai Municipal Corporation (NMMC) has taken action against a bus conductor after a video surfaced showing a young couple engaging in sexual activity on a moving AC bus. The conductor is being investigated for negligence in failing to intervene. The incident occurred on a bus traveling from Panvel to Kalyan, and the video was captured by a motorist.

title: 'Zero. I don’t miss tennis at all'
content: Rafael Nadal, the tennis legend, has revealed he doesn't miss playing professionally after retiring last November. Honored with the Sporting Icon award, Nadal stated he concluded his career content, recognizing his physical limitations. He delayed the decision to ensure it was right, ultimately stopping when his body couldn't meet the demands of enjoying the sport.

title: Trump vs. Kai: President doubts granddaughter can beat him at golf anytime soon
content: Donald Trump praised his 17-year-old granddaughter Kai as a “fantastic” golfer but joked she’s still not good enough to beat him. In a recent vlog, the two shared a playful moment about their golf rivalry. Kai, who is ranked No. 1 in high school girls’ golf and has a $1.2 million NIL valuation, recently signed deals with TaylorMade and Leaf Trading Cards. Despite a tough showing at a major junior tournament, she’s rising fast and Trump says her moment to win is coming, just “not anytime soon.”

title: The Ayush Mhatre story
content: Seventeen-year-old Ayush Mhatre, the youngest player for CSK, stunned fans with a fearless 32-run innings against MI. Coached by Dinesh Lad, Mhatre's confidence mirrors a young Rohit Sharma. Despite facing depression and fitness challenges, Mhatre's father's unwavering support and rigorous training propelled him to success.

title: K'taka issues guidelines, CBSE and ICSE private schools under scanner
content: The Karnataka Department of School Education and Literacy has reiterated strict guidelines for private school admissions for the 2025–26 academic year. Schools must display seat availability, fee details, and admission schedules publicly. Fifty percent of seats must be reserved for girls, and interviews or capitation fees are strictly prohibited. Institutions must follow board-specific and state regulations. Non-compliance, including by CBSE and ICSE schools, will attract action, ensuring fair and transparent admissions across the state.

title: Man dumped by 9 wives for abusive behaviour kills 10th over theft suspicion
content: In Chhattisgarh's Jashpur district, Dhula Ram fatally assaulted his tenth wife, Basanti Bai, suspecting her of stealing food and clothing from a wedding. He concealed her body in a forest, where it was discovered five days later due to the foul odor.

title: Rahane slams openers after KKR's crushing defeat against GT
content: Kolkata Knight Riders faced a 39-run defeat against Gujarat Titans, with skipper Ajinkya Rahane acknowledging the team's struggles with opening partnerships. Rahane emphasized the need for improved batting, especially in the middle overs, despite the bowlers' consistent performance.

title: Gensol Engineering under ED scanner over 'links' to Mahadev betting app case
content: The Enforcement Directorate is set to interrogate Gensol Engineering's promoters, Anmol and Puneet Singh Jaggi, amidst a probe into the Mahadev Book app's illegal betting and money laundering activities. The ED has already frozen over 500,000 shares of the company, suspecting stock price manipulation using illicit funds routed through foreign portfolio investors.

title: ‘Right decision will be taken at appropriate time’: T.N. Finance Minister on Old Pension Scheme
content: During the Question Hour in the Assembly, Thangam Thennarasu said: “The government and the Chief Minister have carefully taken their all demands into consideration.”

title: Chennai River Restoration Trust to restore 12 waterbodies across T.N.: Minister
content: The Chennai River Restoration Trust (CRRT), which undertook the Adyar project, will restore 12 major waterbodies across Tamil Nadu

title: Tamil Nadu govt. to apply for GI tag for tamarind from Dharmapuri
content: The Minister was responding to a query by Pattali Makkal Katchi’s G.K. Mani (Pennagaram) during the Question Hour

title: ‘IAF officer’s allegations against Karnataka and Kannadigas baseless’: CM Siddaramaiah reacts to Bengaluru road rage case
content: While condemning the road rage incident, the CM also warned the people of Karnataka from giving into provocations and taking the law into their hands.

title: Waqf tribunal being established in Madurai: T.N. Minister
content: A G.O. was issued in March this year to create 13 posts in the Waqf tribunal in Madurai, Minister for Minorities and Non-Resident Tamils Welfare S.M. Nasar said in the Assembly

title: Assess glass industry impact on Taj Mahal: Supreme Court to NEERI
content: Supreme Court said all government agencies including the pollution control board should assist NEERI in the exercise

title: Andhra Pradesh CID arrests suspended Intelligence DG Anjaneyulu in actor harassment case
content: The former intelligence chief, along with two IPS officers, and others allegedly foisted false case and arrested actor Kadambari Jethwani and her parents during YSR Congress government

title: EMU train coach derails at Chennai Beach railway station
content: Southern Railway said at 11:08 a.m., a coach of the EMU, while leaving Chennai Beach suburban yard, got derailed. No casualty or injury was reported.

title: Return to work, leave tainted-untainted list to govt: Mamata to protesting teachers
content: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee, promising salary protection and job security, urges protesting teachers to return to work

title: Gauhati High Court gets bomb threat, search operation on
content: A senior official of the Gauhati High Court said the email was received from an unknown organisation, named ‘Madras Tigers’, which threatened to blow up the entire building.

title: Businessman, wife found murdered at home in Kerala’s Kottayam
content: The deceased are Vijaya Kumar, owner of an auditorium at Thirunakkara, and his wife Meera. The incident came to light around 8:45 a.m. when their domestic help arrived and discovered the bodies

title: Every word spoken by constitutional functionary guided by national interest: Dhankhar
content: VP Dhankhar also said there is no visualisation in the Constitution of any authority above Parliament

title: U.S. Vice-President J.D. Vance, family visit Jaipur's Amber Fort
content: U.S. Vice-President J.D. Vance and family visit Amber Fort, Jaipur, receiving a grand welcome and exploring the historic palace

title: India, U.S. have finalised terms of reference for proposed bilateral trade agreement: USTR
content: India and U.S. they made "significant progress" in negotiations for a mutually beneficial bilateral trade pact as Prime Minister Narendra Modi and U.S. Vice President J.D. Vance held wide-ranging talks in New Delhi

title: India’s growth story over next two decades hinges on bold reforms, says FM Nirmala Sitharaman
content: ‘The last two Union Budgets have laid the groundwork for this transformation, with a clear multi-sectoral policy agenda,’ Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said, while speaking at Hoover Institution at Stanford University in California.

title: Supreme Court agrees to hear next week plea on Nishikant Dubey's remarks on judiciary
content: The matter was mentioned for urgent listing before a bench of Justices B.R. Gavai and Augustine George Masih

title: T.N. CM Stalin unveils statue of Dr. V. Shanta at Adyar Cancer Institute
content: The CM offered floral respects to Dr. Shanta’s statue, honouring her remarkable legacy in revolutionising cancer treatment in the country

title: India clinches four medals at EGMO for maths Olympiad
content: EGMO, an annual mathematics competition, was held last week from April 11 to 17, with at least 50 countries participating in the competition

title: Man gets death penalty for rape, murder of minor in Kalaburagi
content: Imposing a fine of ₹1 lakh on the convict, the court has ordered a compensation of ₹4 lakh for the victim’s family

title: West Bengal Governor Ananda Bose shifted to private hospital for further treatment
content: West Bengal Governor C.V. Ananda Bose had complained of chest congestion after returning from a visit to riot-hit areas of Murshidabad on April 19

title: Watch: Diving into Supreme Court’s verdict on assent of bill by Governor, President
content: On April 8, 2025, the Supreme Court decided a long-simmering dispute between the Governor of the State of Tamil Nadu, and the State’s government and Legislative Assembly

title: Kerala Govt. vs Governor:  TN verdict not applicable to Kerala, Centre tells SC
content: Supreme Court to consider pleas of Kerala against Governor over delay in approving bills passed by State Assembly

title: Man kills woman, sets the body on fire in Kalaburagi
content: On being questioned by police, the man claimed to have killed the woman, as she had forced him to marry her

title: ED summons actor Mahesh Babu for questioning in money laundering probe involving Hyderabad real estate firms
content: The ED is examining Mahesh Babu’s financial transactions with Sai Surya Developers as part of its money laundering probe

title: Now, IAF officer booked for attempt to murder in Bengaluru road rage case
content: After verifying the CCTV footage and recordings of the incidents from bystanders, it was allegedly revealed that Wg. Cdr. Bose had also attacked and assaulted Vikas Kumar, and kicked him after he fell on the road.

title: Telangana Inter Exams 2025 results announced; pass percentage is 65.80
content: Candidates can apply for recounting from April 23. Intermediate advanced supplementary theory examinations will be held from May 22.

title: J.D. Vance in India LIVE Day 2 | President Trump wants to build a future with India: Vance
content: The U.S. Vice President met PM Modi on Monday where the two reviewed ties between India and U.S.; Mr. Modi hosted Mr. Vance’s family for dinner

title: ‘Targeted for raising corruption issue’: Congress leaders after visiting Indore leader in jail
content: Speaking to reporters outside the prison, Harish Choudhary said that the case against Chintu Choukse was lodged out of “political vengeance” and that it was not a case of attempt to murder

title: Massive fire breaks out at ONGC factory in West Bengal’s Domjur, no casualties so far
content: Meanwhile, hours before the fire incident at Domjur, two people died in a massive fire at a cloth warehouse on Pathuriaghata Street in North Kolkata.

title: POCSO case registered against four staffers of Isha Foundation, former student in Coimbatore
content: The case relates to alleged sexual assault by the accused student on another student and the alleged negligence on the part of the staffers

title: Maoist killed in encounter in Chhattisgarh
content: The encounter took place around 5.30 p.m. when a joint team of Thana Bedare and Chhasbal 7/E Company Camp Nugur under Thana Bedare area

title: Madras High Court refuses to reject plea filed by O. Paneerselvam challenging MP Navas Kani’s election
content: Justice C.V. Karthikeyan holds that allegations of misrepresentation and suppression of facts in the election affidavit can be ascertained only after a full-fledged trial

title: FM Nirmala Sitharaman meets business leaders in San Francisco
content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, who is on a 11-day trip to the U.S. and Peru,discusses bilateral cooperation, investment opportunities with business leaders in San Franciso.

title: ‘Mohammed bin Salman a strong advocate of bilateral ties’, says PM Modi in interview
content: PM Modi praises Saudi Crown Prince as a strong advocate of bilateral ties and invites Saudi companies to invest in India

title: Kerala government declares three-day State mourning as a mark of respect for Pope Francis
content: Decision follows Union Ministry of Home Affairs’ letter to State governments declaring a period of national mourning

title: Supreme Court collegium recommends transfer of two Telangana HC judges
content: The Union government is yet to approve these recommendations for transfer of the judges and notify the same

title: Pope Francis maintained close ties with Church in India
content: He strived to find solution to a long simmering dispute over Mass liturgy in the Ernakulam-Angamaly archdiocese

title: PM Modi’s Saudi trip | Nations to ink 6 pacts, PM to discuss Hajj quota with Crown Prince
content: Mr. Modi is on a two-day trip to Saudi Arabia at the invitation of Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, and it will mark the first visit by an Indian Prime Minister in 40 years to Jeddah.

title: Judiciary’s place atop the pyramid
content: The Vice-President’s recent criticism of the judiciary has received a mixed response, but complaints about it’s lack of transparency and accountability — apprehensions also shared by the public — need to be addressed appropriately

title: Why did China block exports of rare earth elements?
content: What are rare earth elements? Why did China restrict their imports? How do the restrictions impact India?

title: ‘Phule’ and censorship: How Bollywood’s elite resist caste-conscious cinema
content: ‘Phule’ seems to be the latest among the long line of alternative movies that have faced significant hurdles on the way to the big screen, simply for exploring Dalit-Bahujan identities and narratives that mainstream Hindi cinema has often shied away from; and it’s not without a pattern it seems

title: Government imposes 12% safeguard duty on certain steel products for 200 days
content: While some big domestic steel makers advocate for duty imposition, the user industry is strongly against it as it would push raw material prices, impacting their competitiveness

title: Contrary to expectations, Karnataka’s mango yield drops again due to harsh weather
content: The farmers have not seen a profitable year for a long time now, at least four to five years. This year, the flowering was not good due to temperature of around 33 to 34 degrees Celsius

title: India announces three-day state mourning on passing of Pope Francis
content: During the period of the state mourning, the national flag will be flown at half mast throughout India on all buildings where the national flag is flown regularly and there will be no official entertainment

title: Tribals are ‘biggest Hindus’, says Chhattisgarh Chief Minister; Baghel rebuts claims
content: As per the 2011 census, the share of tribals in Chhatisgarh’s population was 30.62% with the population concentrated in Sarguja and Bastar regions of North and South Chhattisgarh respectively

title: E-cigarette racket busted in Hyderabad; brothers held for peddling vapes to students
content: The deliveries were handled by courier services like DTDC and ride-hailing platforms such as Uber and Rapido, which may now find themselves in the dock for failing to screen parcels given to minors, said the Director of TGANB, Sandeep Shandilya.

title: Cruise operators commence at Mumbai International Cruise Terminal, India’s largest
content: Spread over a built-up area of over 4.15 lakh square feet, the MICT has been developed at Ballard Pier. The total investment in the MICT project is ₹556 crore

title: Petition dismissed after Nashik dargah withdraws it from the Supreme Court
content: The dargah was demolished by the municipal corporation a few days ago, hours before the apex court stayed its demolition

title: Calcutta University scholars travel to Sundarbans village to save language
content: They are translating into the English a novel about char lands, river erosion, loss of land, and the vulnerability of people’s life there, written by a local in a tribal language called Sadri

title: First stop Akshardham Temple for Vances, U.S. VP says his 'kids, in particular, loved it'
content: “A carved wooden elephant, a model of the Delhi Akshardham Temple and children’s books were gifted to the family”

title: Sainthoods, Cardinal elevation: a papacy marked by a keen engagement with India
content: Francis, who was the first non-European Pope in nearly 1,300 years, died on Easter Monday. He was 88. The Pope was diagnosed with double pneumonia

title: ‘Wasn’t consulted’: Maharashtra language panel chief on Hindi row
content: The committee has already written a letter to Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis advising to revoke the decision

title: HCA cannot take any financial decisions: HC interim direction
content: The interim direction was passed in a writ petition filed by the Telangana Cricket Association, levelling serious allegations against HCA, accusing its office bearers of indulging in corruption

title: SNDP: 13 components from Phase-I remain non-starters within and outside Hyderabad
content: Officials cite various reasons ranging from lack of right of way and difficulties in utility shifting

title: W.B. school recruitment crisis: fresh protests erupt outside WBSSC office over demand of list of ‘tainted’ and ‘untainted’ candidates
content: Hundreds of teachers laid siege to the Commission’s office, demanding the immediate publication of the list and the resignation of the Education Minister and the WBSSC Chairperson, after the agency missed the promised deadline.

title: Final-year IIT Kharagpur student found dead in hostel
content: Following the second unnatural student death at IIT Kharagpur this year, the Institute’s Teachers’ Association is demanding the immediate appointment of a permanent director.

title: First consignment of organic compost from Brahmapuram to Dubai flagged off
content: The compost, produced through an eco-friendly process using Black Soldier Fly (BSF) larvae, is being exported to the Dubai-based SSK Blending LLC for their vertical farming initiatives.

title: Two linked with father-son murder in Murshidabad arrested in Odisha
content: Six other Murshidabad men who had allegedly participated in the violence during the protests against the Waqf Act were detained in Jharsuguda

title: ED carrying on vendetta against Congress: Chidambaram on National Herald case
content: Congress leader P. Chidambaram said there was no case since there was no transaction of money and, therefore, no proceeds of crime nor any money laundering.

title: Prashant Kishor demands White Paper on caste-based survey; ‘unfulfilled promises’
content: Mr. Kishor asserted that states like Andhra Pradesh, which started their land survey after Bihar, have digitized 80% of the land so far, but Bihar has only digitized 20%.

title: National Herald case a political conspiracy: Kanhaiya Kumar
content: ‘No one is speaking about the finances of BJP and RSS. From where are they getting the money to build their plush offices in every city?’

title: Quraishi slams Dubey; says for some, religious identities are staple to forward hateful politics
content: Nishikant Dubey's barb at the former CEC came a day after his vitriolic attack on the Supreme Court and Chief Justice of Sanjiv Khanna, blaming the CJI for causing "civil wars" in India.

title: Gold was being smuggled to India after declaring it to be taken either to Geneva or Bangkok: DRI tells Karnataka High Court
content: Ranya was booking tickets both to Geneva or Bangkok but travelling to India without cancelling other ticket

title: Liquor scam: SIT police arrests Kasireddy Rajasekhar Reddy at RGIA airport in Hyderabad
content: A team of police are shifting Kasireddy to Vijayawada, and will produce him in the court, according to a senior police officer

title: Jammu-Srinagar National Highway remains blocked for second day
content: It will take around three days to restore traffic on Jammu-Srinagar highway, says CM; Jammu Divisional Commissioner says departments instructed to expedite restoration of public utilities

title: Private schools warned against conducting tests, interviews for students and parents for admission
content: Commissioner of Public Instruction in a circular says 50% seats should be mandatorily reserved for girls in all co-educational schools

title: College baseball Week 10: Top 25 rankings and what to watch
content: we're getting down to crunch time for some teams to prove themselves . the biggest riser was Vanderbilt, which jumped up 10 spots after sweeping Georgia . Ole Miss dropped 12 spots to no. 23 in the ranking this week after losing a road series to south Carolina .

title: Clippers back on track after Leonard outduels Jokic
content: no. 4 Denver Nuggets and no. 5 LA Clippers played another close thriller . the series now heads to Intuit Dome for the first playoff games to play at the NBA's newest arena . here's what matters most and what to watch in all four series .

title: Pistons snap historic 15-game playoff drought as Towns has quiet night for Knicks
content: Cade Cunningham and the Detroit Pistons are back in their series against the no. 3 new york Knicks after hanging onto a Game 2 win at Madison Square Garden . the other two East series will pick back up Wednesday . here's what matters most and what to expect from the playoffs .

title: Terrorists attack Pahalgam resort in J&K, several tourists injured
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports .

title: European soccer review: Real Madrid still in title race, plus much more
content: the laLiga title race is nearly officially over, but the race for european places is as competitive as ever . in the Bundesliga, Germany's last remaining clubs were knocked out of european competition, but Bayern Munich returned to some sense of normalcy by dismantling a relative minnow .
